thread.title: Is this what Beyoncé's twins will look like? Artist sketches first portrait of Carter babies using parents' features
thread.title_full: Is this what Beyoncé's twins will look like? Artist sketches first portrait of Carter babies using parents' features

author: Jessica Gibb
title: Is this what Beyoncé's twins will look like? Artist sketches first portrait of Carter babies using parents' features
text:
Is this what Beyoncé's twins will look like? Artist sketches first portrait of Carter babies using parents' features Share World's first picture of Beyonce and Jay-Z twins by age-progression expert artist Dr D'Lynn Waldron (Photo: Dr D'Lynn Waldron/ Splash News) Share Get   
The world is eagerly awaiting the birth of Beyoncé's twins following her shock pregnancy announcement this week. 
But an age-progression expert has given fans a sneak peek of what the newest members of the Carter family might look like. 
Using a mixture of features from Bey and her husband Jay Z, D'Lynn Waldron has created the first image of what the twins could look like. Beyonce with daughter Blue Ivy (Photo: Twitter) 
Earlier today, Beyoncé's dad Mathew Knowles hinted that his superstar daughter is expecting a boy and a girl. 
And the artist took the hint creating an image of one baby girl and one baby boy. 
The Drunk In Love star shocked the world when she announced she was expecting twins later this year. 
And talking about the happy news, Beyoncé's dad and former manager shared: “I’m extremely proud and happy, both with Jay and her. 
“And Blue Ivy is going to have some brothers and sisters. She is already excited.” Beyonce and Jay Z share throwback pics (Photo: beyonce.com) Beyonce (Photo: Beyonce.com) 
He also revealed that prior to Beyoncé's big reveal, he had no idea she was expecting. 
Mathew, who teaches entertainment industry courses at Texas Southern University, explained on The Insider: "I was shocked. Let me tell you what happened. I got a first text, and I was like, 'Why is this person saying congratulations?' 
"Then I get a second text from one of my students at Texas Southern, and I was like, 'What are you talking about?' He was like, 'Go to the web.' I didn't know myself." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
